description: Borrowed from Latin applaudere (“to clap the hands together, applaud”), from ad (“to”) + plaudere (“to strike, clap”).

verbs.description: applaud (third-person singular simple present applauds, present participle applauding, simple past and past participle applauded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To express approval (of something) by clapping the hands.
examples: After the performance, the audience applauded for five minutes.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To praise, or express approval for something or someone.
examples: Although we don't like your methods, we applaud your motives.
